intro: Elsholtzia leptostachya, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed elsholtzia, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central and southern China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its inflorescence consists of whorled clusters of small, pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. Elsholtzia leptostachya is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
